fields.value: Comparative Study of Ethnic Minorities in California (M163V1)

datasetContactAffiliation.value: University of California, Los Angeles. Social Science Data Archive

dsDescriptionValue.value: "Currently political participation, especially voter registration and turnout, varies substantially with ethnicity. Blacks and non-Hispanic whites participate at roughly equal rates, while Latinos and Asian-Americans are substantially less active. This variation may reflect culatural factors, or it may be the spurious product of differences in the distribution of non-ethnic determinants of participation, including socioeconomic and demographic characteristics, variables reflecting immigration history, including citicenzhip, and measures of group idintification. Using data collected in 1984 on samples of California's black, Latino, Asian-American, and non-Hispanic white populations, we conclude that these other variables fully account for lower Latino participation rates. Even with such controls, however, Asian-Americans remain less likely to vote. Athough non-citizens particiape less than citizens, they do engage in non-electoral activities. Finally, we specualte on the future political impact of Latinos and Asian-American, by projecting participation rates under several scenarios."

publicationCitation.value:
Cho, Wendy Tam.  “Naturalization, Socialization, Participation: Immigrants and (Non-) Voting.” Journal of Politics 61, 4 (November 1999): 1140–1155.
</br></br>
Lien, Pei-te. 1994. “Ethnicity and Political Participation: A Comparison between Asian and Mexican Americans,” Political Behavior (16):237-264. 
</br></br>
Cain, Bruce E., D. Roderick Kiewiet, and Carole Jean Uhlaner.  "The Acquisition of Partisanship by Latinos and Asian-Americans."   American Journal of Political Science 35 (May 1991): 390-422. 
</br></br>
Uhlaner, Carole Jean, Bruce E. Cain, and D. Roderick Kiewiet. "Political Participation of Ethnic Minorities in the 1980s."  Political Behavior 11 (September 1989): 195-231.
</br></br>
Uhlaner, Carole Jean.  "Political Participation and Discrimination: A Comparative Analysis of Asians, Blacks, and Latinos."  In Political Participation and American Democracy,  ed. William Crotty.  New York: Greenwood Press, 1991, pp. 139-170.
</br></br>
Uhlaner, Carole Jean.  "Perceived Discrimination and Prejudice and the Coalition Prospects of Blacks, Latinos, and Asian Americans."  In Ethnic and Racial Politics in California, ed. Byron O. Jackson and Michael B. Preston.  Berkeley, CA: Institute of Governmental Studies Press, 1991, pp. 339-371.
</br></br>
Uhlaner, Carole Jean.  "Political Activity and Preferences of African Americans, Latinos, and Asian Americans."  In Immigration and Race:  New Challenges for American Democracy, ed. Gerald D. Jaynes.  New Haven:  Yale University Press, 2000, pp. 217-254.
